recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Baingan Bharta or mashed eggplant is a popular dish in Indian Cuisine. In this dish, eggplant is first grilled on direct fire or stove top or oven for a smokey flavor. It is then mixed with spices and served with rotis or rice.
Eggplant, also known as Brinjal, is a good source of fiber. It contains high amount of water, and important in maintenance of healthy skin and hair.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: First, roast the eggplant on stove or in oven. Pierce the eggplant several times with a fork to make small holes for the steam to escape. Apply thin layer of oil all over the eggplant. If using an oven, preheat oven to 350°F (~175°C) and roast it for approx 40 mins or till the outer layer becomes dark in color. Remove from the oven, wait for it to cool down. If you are using a stove top, put a cooking rack on stove for safety. Put eggplant on the rack and let it get cooked for 2 mins. Keep rotating the eggplant till entire it is cooked which may take upto 10 mins or less. Peel off the skin. Smash the eggplant

Meanwhile, heat oil in a wok or pan. Add cumin seeds. Let it splutter. Add green chillies, ginger and garlic. Fry for 30 sec or till the raw smell goes away. Add onions and fry till it it changes to brown.
Add all dry powders and fry for 30 secs, then add tomatoes. Fry till tomatoes are cooked completely and oil starts separating.

Add roasted eggplant and salt. Mix it well. Cover and cook on low flame for 5 mins so that eggplant gets cooked with masala. Add lemon juice and mix it well. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve with rotis or as a side dish.
